title: Russian attacks kill top judge and three others in Ukraine's Kharkiv, officials say
content: In Ukraine's Kharkiv region, two Russian assaults claimed four lives, including a Supreme Court judge. An airstrike on Slatyne caused three fatalities and injured at least three others. Meanwhile, a drone attack on Kozacha Lopan killed the judge and injured three women. The attacks also damaged civilian infrastructure.
summary: In Ukraine's Kharkiv region, two Russian assaults claimed four lives, including a Supreme Court judge. An airstrike on Slatyne caused three fatalities and injured at least three others. Meanwhile, a drone attack on Kozacha Lopan killed the judge and injured three women. The attacks also damaged civilian infrastructure.

title: Missiles fired at Israel from Yemen and Lebanon in response to Hezbollah leader Nasrallah's death: Top developments
content: Yemen's Houthi rebels fired a missile at Israel's Ben Gurion Airport, targeting the Israeli Prime Minister after attending the UNGA meeting. This marks their second attack in two days following Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah's death in an Israeli airstrike. International leaders call for ceasefires and diplomatic solutions to avoid further escalation.
summary: Yemen's Houthi rebels fired a missile at Israel's Ben Gurion Airport, targeting the Israeli Prime Minister after attending the UNGA meeting. This marks their second attack in two days following Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah's death in an Israeli airstrike. International leaders call for ceasefires and diplomatic solutions to avoid further escalation.

title: Months of intelligence, a few minutes of bombs: How Israel killed Hezbollah chief Nasrallah
content: Israeli leaders had been aware of Hassan Nasrallah's location for months and chose to strike this past week due to a limited window of opportunity. Over 80 bombs were dropped in the attack, resulting in the deaths of Nasrallah and Ali Karaki, a top Hezbollah commander. The operation was planned amid cease-fire discussions with American counterparts.
summary: Israeli leaders had been aware of Hassan Nasrallah's location for months and chose to strike this past week due to a limited window of opportunity. Over 80 bombs were dropped in the attack, resulting in the deaths of Nasrallah and Ali Karaki, a top Hezbollah commander. The operation was planned amid cease-fire discussions with American counterparts.

Labour MP Rosie Duffield resigns, accuses UK PM Starmer of 'hypocrisy'
content: Rosie Duffield resigned from the Labour Party, accusing Prime Minister Keir Starmer of hypocrisy for accepting gifts while cutting winter heating payments for pensioners. She criticized his policies as inconsistent with Labour values. The controversy has caused friction within the party, especially during their first conference since regaining power.
summary: Rosie Duffield resigned from the Labour Party, accusing Prime Minister Keir Starmer of hypocrisy for accepting gifts while cutting winter heating payments for pensioners. She criticized his policies as inconsistent with Labour values. The controversy has caused friction within the party, especially during their first conference since regaining power.

title: Hezbollah leader Nasrallah killed: Israeli PM Netanyahu says 'settled score'
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu declared that Israel had "settled the score" with the assassination of Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah in a Beirut airstrike. Netanyahu highlighted Nasrallah's role in numerous deaths, including Americans and French citizens. He asserted that eliminating Nasrallah was essential for achieving Israel's objectives and facilitating the return of hostages captured by Hamas.
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu declared that Israel had "settled the score" with the assassination of Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah in a Beirut airstrike. Netanyahu highlighted Nasrallah's role in numerous deaths, including Americans and French citizens. He asserted that eliminating Nasrallah was essential for achieving Israel's objectives and facilitating the return of hostages captured by Hamas.

title: Nasrallah, Hezbollah chief for 32 years, killed in Israel airstrike
content: Hezbollah confirmed that its leader Hassan Nasrallah was killed in an Israeli airstrike in Beirut. The strike also resulted in the deaths of other Hezbollah commanders and an Iranian general. Israel announced plans to intensify its operations against Hezbollah, leading to substantial displacement among Lebanese and Israelis amid escalating tensions.
summary: Hezbollah confirmed that its leader Hassan Nasrallah was killed in an Israeli airstrike in Beirut. The strike also resulted in the deaths of other Hezbollah commanders and an Iranian general. Israel announced plans to intensify its operations against Hezbollah, leading to substantial displacement among Lebanese and Israelis amid escalating tensions.

title: 'More high profile than...': Attorney says Diddy's secret tapes being sold in Hollywood
content: ​“There already have been tapes leaking around Hollywood being shopped around, but one particular person contacted me to shop a particular video,” Mitchell-Kidd said. “I can tell the video was pornographic. This was in his Atlanta home, and it does seem like the person isn’t looking into the video. To me, it doesn’t seem like that person knows they’re being videotaped.”
summary: ​“There already have been tapes leaking around Hollywood being shopped around, but one particular person contacted me to shop a particular video,” Mitchell-Kidd said. “I can tell the video was pornographic. This was in his Atlanta home, and it does seem like the person isn’t looking into the video. To me, it doesn’t seem like that person knows they’re being videotaped.”

title: 'Measure of justice...': US President Joe Biden on Hezbollah leader Nasrallah's death
content: US President Joe Biden termed the death of Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah in an Israeli airstrike as 'a measure of justice.' The incident follows Hezbollah's engagement in the conflict post-Hamas’s October 7, 2023, attack on Israel. Biden reiterated US support for Israel and highlighted ongoing diplomatic efforts to de-escalate tensions.
summary: US President Joe Biden termed the death of Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah in an Israeli airstrike as 'a measure of justice.' The incident follows Hezbollah's engagement in the conflict post-Hamas’s October 7, 2023, attack on Israel. Biden reiterated US support for Israel and highlighted ongoing diplomatic efforts to de-escalate tensions.

title: Meghan Markle sends emails to her staff at 5 am but is kind enough to...
content: ​"My working day may not be your working day. Please do not feel obliged to reply to this email outside your normal working hours," Meghan writes this in her mails. Her staff claimed she is flexible and fair-minded like that. Meghan has around 16 staffers working for production on various Netflix projects, podcasts, the Archewell Foundation, and communications. Meghan shares credit and writes personal email thanking her staff for their contribution, an ex-staffer said.
summary: ​"My working day may not be your working day. Please do not feel obliged to reply to this email outside your normal working hours," Meghan writes this in her mails. Her staff claimed she is flexible and fair-minded like that. Meghan has around 16 staffers working for production on various Netflix projects, podcasts, the Archewell Foundation, and communications. Meghan shares credit and writes personal email thanking her staff for their contribution, an ex-staffer said.

title: Lavrov warns against 'fighting to victory' with nuclear power, blasts western nations at UN
content: Sergey Lavrov, Russia's foreign minister, warned against efforts to defeat a nuclear power like Russia, addressing the Ukraine conflict at the UN General Assembly. He criticised Western actions and called Zelenskyy's peace formula a doomed ultimatum. The nuclear threat has been significant since Russia invaded Ukraine in February 2022.
summary: Sergey Lavrov, Russia's foreign minister, warned against efforts to defeat a nuclear power like Russia, addressing the Ukraine conflict at the UN General Assembly. He criticised Western actions and called Zelenskyy's peace formula a doomed ultimatum. The nuclear threat has been significant since Russia invaded Ukraine in February 2022.

Laura Loomer now attacks Kamala Harris on religion. 'Has anyone asked her?'
content: Far-right activist Laura Loomer questioned Kamala Harris' religion after she confirmed she would skip the AI Smith dinner on October 17. Loomer's controversial remarks about Harris' ethnicity were condemned by Republicans and distanced by Donald Trump. Harris has a unique religious identity, having been introduced to both Hinduism and Christianity, as she said earlier.
summary: Far-right activist Laura Loomer questioned Kamala Harris' religion after she confirmed she would skip the AI Smith dinner on October 17. Loomer's controversial remarks about Harris' ethnicity were condemned by Republicans and distanced by Donald Trump. Harris has a unique religious identity, having been introduced to both Hinduism and Christianity, as she said earlier.

title: Hurricane Helene traps families, leaves North Carolina mountain towns in ruins
content: Hurricane Helene's impact on North Carolina's mountain regions has left families isolated due to landslides and flooding. The storm made landfall in Florida and caused at least 52 fatalities across five states. Major roadways are closed, with preliminary damage estimates ranging from $15 billion to $26 billion.
summary: Hurricane Helene's impact on North Carolina's mountain regions has left families isolated due to landslides and flooding. The storm made landfall in Florida and caused at least 52 fatalities across five states. Major roadways are closed, with preliminary damage estimates ranging from $15 billion to $26 billion.

title: Israeli PM Netanyahu presents maps at UN, labels India a 'blessing' and Iran a 'curse'
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu addressed the UN General Assembly, displaying two maps one as a "blessing" and the other as a "curse. He described the map titled 'The Curse' featured Iran, Iraq, Syria, and Yemen colored in black, while the map labeled 'The Blessing' highlighted Egypt, Sudan, Saudi Arabia, and India in green.
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu addressed the UN General Assembly, displaying two maps one as a "blessing" and the other as a "curse. He described the map titled 'The Curse' featured Iran, Iraq, Syria, and Yemen colored in black, while the map labeled 'The Blessing' highlighted Egypt, Sudan, Saudi Arabia, and India in green.

title: This Republican politician 'borrows' wife and children for photoshoot
content: Republican Derrick Anderson, running for Virginia's seventh congressional district, faced backlash after using a friend's family in a campaign photoshoot. Anderson, who is engaged and childless, defended the footage as featuring supporters. This incident sparked social media criticism and highlighted GOP efforts to attract female voters amid ongoing abortion debates.
summary: Republican Derrick Anderson, running for Virginia's seventh congressional district, faced backlash after using a friend's family in a campaign photoshoot. Anderson, who is engaged and childless, defended the footage as featuring supporters. This incident sparked social media criticism and highlighted GOP efforts to attract female voters amid ongoing abortion debates.

title: Queen Camilla does not want King Charles to meet Prince Harry because...
content: ​The King sent a birthday wish to Prince Harry as the prince turned 40 hinting at a thawing of their relationship caused by the hurt that Prince Harry delivered by badmouthing the Royal Family and then quitting the royal responsibilities. But a public birthday wish is the most King Charles would do, a meeting may not happen but nobody is ruling out a meeting as well.
summary: ​The King sent a birthday wish to Prince Harry as the prince turned 40 hinting at a thawing of their relationship caused by the hurt that Prince Harry delivered by badmouthing the Royal Family and then quitting the royal responsibilities. But a public birthday wish is the most King Charles would do, a meeting may not happen but nobody is ruling out a meeting as well.
